pageContext.Title: Javascript - Testing & Error prevention
pageContext.Description: Test-driven development has been around for a while but it gained traction in the last years, becoming the norm for many software teams. In this Guide you will try out this methodology. Also in this Guide you will make use of Typescript, which allows you to, for example, write strongly-typed Javascript and avoid errors in run time.

Skills.Skill: Be able to create test units for Javascript code

actionPoints.actionPoint: Read-up on Test-driven Development as a whole
Learn about Jest or similar and create a few demos
Learn about Typescript and use it in the Deliverable

Deliver.Title: Interactive web application
Deliver.Description:
• Submit:
    • Glitch Project URL or Github Repository + Github Pages URLs
      • Add comments for each relevant code block
    • Project description and details in the README.md file
  • Minimum requirements:
    • Create a web application that relies on user input
    • Written in Typescript
    • Create tests with Jest (or similar tool) to make sure all the interactive points will work
  • Theme ideas:
    • Chatbot
    • Tool to create a poster
